column5: throwing big lures with treble hooks in a small boat with an ADHD chocolate Lab is not a good mix. He’s fine though, he came snorkelling with me yesterday. I’ll tell him “Bill says hello”.
Thanks for sharing Simon - looks like you and the dog are having a blast Must be awesome having such an awesome multi species fishery in your backyard Andrew

Poor pooch is getting on a bit, but he still loves swimming. When I first moved here I hated fishing on Wabigoon lake, fast forward 13 years and I don’t really fish anywhere else now, absolutely awesome fishery once you learn the rules( still room for more learning), and I absolutely don’t take it for granted that it’s at the bottom of my yard, if I ever do I don’t deserve it.

Been fishing almost exclusively for musky this past week by myself and two evenings with a Father and son staying at Indian Point Camp where I guide from time to time. I’m relatively new to the musky game, and scoffed at people when they told me it’s addictive, I have to admit I have an addiction…. 😂. Been raising fish, follows, and heartbreaking losses before getting the net under them, too many to even put a number to, but did put some in the boat.
Nice fish! Now time to sign yourself up for the tourney on July 31.
Wow, that is awesome. One fish I haven't caught that is on my bucket list!
Those goon fish have some of the coolest markings!! Maybe someday…
Nice fish! Where's the dog? Bill
I’m the standby guy if a friend who is signed up has to work.
